meanings.definition: To punch harder or more effectively than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the boxing match, Mike managed to outpunch his opponent with swift jabs.
meanings.sent2: In the fight, the champion always tries to outpunch his challengers to maintain his title.
meanings.sent3: The superhero outpunched the villain, sending him flying through the air.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was so strong that she could outpunch any obstacle in her way.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her outpunching the heavy bag echoed through the gym.

meanings.definition: To exceed in punching power or force.
meanings.sent1: The heavyweight boxer can outpunch his opponents with his incredible strength.
meanings.sent2: The martial artist trained hard to outpunch his previous records in the gym.
meanings.sent3: The robot's mechanical arm could outpunch any human with its precision and power.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed was so strong that he could outpunch any challenge that came his way.
meanings.sent5: The storm's winds seemed to outpunch even the strongest buildings in the city.
